attributes.action: Obliterate Camps in no-man's-land and massed at front lines as being biological weapons
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Whores and wars
To brutalise the land
All breeding foreseeing
Crimes unplanned
Be they against residual humanity
Or what remains less than a planet
Engulfed in ignorance above insanity
If any God
Curse more than randomness that began it

And while you worship the 'Glorious Dead,'
>From a war to end it all
You represent their obverse instead
You call to 'Action Men!' minds small
Where policing of capitalist pyramid schemes thrall
Could default the breeding apes
Genes forlorn
Children of dreams
All doth thou warn
Of carnage
Of eternal exploitation
Of some territory
Of some nation
Of some deluded masses
Thralldom
Let them be wasted
They make us boredom

Another matter is the security
Of reasonable individuals held in obscurity
There rests alive the mutual assurance that all are dead
If a nuclear argument be launched instead
Of a petty breeding skirmish
Banish
The bollocks and whores
That in extremis they vanish
Below the scope of the lunatics
In their padded cells
Let build more robotics as padding
No Laws of Robotics?
Ah well!
It's so maddening
The DNA Robots do not seem to need them
Let us call upon silicon
To fight for our freedom

rejection.details: Your petition should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
Statements that don't actually request any action
